item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 19, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Goboscript, text-based programming language, compiles to Scratch (20 points | 5 comments)
2. New research reveals the strongest solar event ever detected, in 12350 BC (139 points | 67 comments)
3. The principles of database design, or, the Truth is out there (40 points | 26 comments)
4. “There are people who can see and others who cannot even look” (98 points | 14 comments)
5. Spaced repetition systems have gotten better (808 points | 440 comments)
6. Ditching Obsidian and building my own (302 points | 318 comments)
7. Layers All the Way Down: The Untold Story of Shader Compilation (26 points | 7 comments)
8. Font Activations: A Note on the Type (25 points | discuss)
9. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (315 points | 97 comments)
10. France Endorses UN Open Source Principles (365 points | 82 comments)
11. $30 Homebrew Automated Blinds Opener (237 points | 97 comments)
12. Show HN: Job board aggregator for best paying remote SWE jobs in the U.S. (29 points | 15 comments)
13. The lack of a good command line way to sort IPv6 addresses (12 points | 8 comments)
14. Show HN: Vaev – A browser engine built from scratch (It renders google.com) (169 points | 82 comments)
15. The Connoisseur of Desire (15 points | discuss)
16. Spaced Repetition Memory System (206 points | 19 comments)
17. Show HN: A platform to find tech conferences, discounts, and ticket giveaways (61 points | 18 comments)
18. The Tongue Is a Fire (16 points | 4 comments)
19. Hyper Typing (72 points | 55 comments)
20. K-Scale Labs: Open-source humanoid robots, built for developers (80 points | 41 comments)
21. Llama from scratch (or how to implement a paper without crying) (3 points | discuss)
22. Comparing Parallel Functional Array Languages: Programming and Performance (65 points | 11 comments)
23. Show HN: Python Simulator of David Deutsch’s “Constructor Theory of Time” (65 points | 7 comments)
24. The Fall of Roam (2022) (110 points | 58 comments)
25. Publisher: The Malloy Semantic Model Server (15 points | discuss)
26. What do wealthy people buy, that ordinary people know nothing about? (2015) (115 points | 157 comments)
27. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (191 points | 23 comments)
28. Mystical (386 points | 44 comments)
29. Show HN: Buckaroo – Data table UI for Notebooks (92 points | 8 comments)
30. Emergent social conventions and collective bias in LLM populations (58 points | 18 comments)
